title: Non-Monogamy: Is it natural for humans?
caption: false

channel_info.title: Robbie Kramer
channel_info.description:
I'm Robbie Kramer 🎙Host of The Inner Confidence Podcast & Founder of Inner Confidence, Inc.

I lived an exhilarating single life filled with adventures and lessons, and ultimately achieved what I had always aspired to – finding an amazing, feminine, and loving wife. 

I believe my experiences provide a rare balance of wild freedom and committed love, equipping me with the insights to help you navigate the complexities of dating and relationships in today's world. Let me guide you to embrace your desires, improve your social prowess, and ultimately attract the partner who aligns with your highest aspirations.

You won’t find any fluffy, new-age, or cringy stuff here, just tested, proven and actionable advice that yields results.

Apply to join our exclusive Inner Confidence Community of ambitious men who are actively working together to achieve their goals faster   ► https://innerconfidence.com/community

You can email me at robbie@innerconfidence.com with any questions or comments.

transcription: {"text": "My belief is that human beings are animals and we have instincts like animals. I just don't know that I think monogamy is very natural, though I don't judge it. Of course, I understand there are structures in place and it works for a lot of people and a lot goes into non-monogamy if you really want to succeed at that. For most of my life, non-monogamy, having a role in my relationship was as important to me as the person itself. It felt to me so counter to everything about myself to tell somebody else that they get to decide what the f*** I do with my body. And I don't like the idea of having the impulse to be sexual or have a sexual relationship with somebody and being told no by some third party. That, to me, always didn't sit right. So when it came to dating, it's not like I approached this with just a wholly healthy outlook in my younger years. I would say I had a bit more of like a masculine approach or a traditionally masculine approach to things that like... Well, I mean, if you think about just the standard narrative...
